article: Why do we take school trips? School trips are a great chance to learn outside the classroom  _  new and interesting ways. For example, on a trip to a farm, we can see  _  of the things we  have learned  about so far in biology lessons. While  _  science museums, we can see science in action. Where can we go on a school trip? In Japan, cherry trees are blossoming by the beginning of the year for students to take school trips. School children have picnic lunches, sing songs and dance under the trees. They  _  go boating and hiking around the lakes and hills. Some kids even take baths in hot springs. If there is  _  , don't worry. They will go to a museum  instead  . In China, students often take school  _  to parks, museums or to visit a mountain. But nowadays it's very popular to take an outward bound trip. Students can learn about survival skills. In the UK, students go to many interesting places. They  pick up  shells on the seaside . Kids may also learn about  _  when they go to a castle or a famous old home.
